revised_title: Developmental Stages and Morphological Variations in Podophthalmous Crustacean Embryos
tldr: The author examines the development and morphological variations in the embryos of 38 genera of podophthalmous crustaceans. By studying the larvae and their parents, the author identifies the parent forms of some known larvae and determines those of several unknown genera. The study reveals a unity of character throughout the various forms and changes of crustaceans, demonstrating the homological truth and the potential for suppressed or tendered parts to be reproduced under specific conditions.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
